snippet: In an excerpt from his new book, "The Behavior Gap," Bucks contributor Carl Richards argues against complete precision in your own financial planning.
abstract: In an excerpt from his new book, "The Behavior Gap," Bucks contributor Carl Richards argues against complete precision in your own financial planning.
lead_paragraph: Carl Richards is a certified financial planner in Park City, Utah. His new book, "The Behavior Gap," was published this week, and we'll be running excerpts all week long. Meanwhile, his sketches are archived here on the Bucks blog.

headline.main: The Financial Lesson in Too Many Skis
